thread.title: 21 of our favorite people say goodbye to the Obama family, the tears just keep on coming
thread.title_full: 21 of our favorite people say goodbye to the Obama family, the tears just keep on coming

author: Stephanie Hallett
title: 21 of our favorite people say goodbye to the Obama family, the tears just keep on coming
text:
21 of our favorite people say goodbye to the Obama family, the tears just keep on coming Saying goodbye to the outgoing first family today was exactly as hard as we imagined it would be. They were the definition of class, dignity, integrity, and partnership, and we will miss them very dearly. We’re not alone in feeling this way, of course: Many of our favorite people are saying goodbye to the Obama family on social media, and with every new post comes a fresh batch of tears .
From words of thanks to personal memories of meeting the president and first lady, stars have lit up Instagram and Twitter with their heartfelt tributes. Below, take a look at some of the most poignant posts.
Zendaya My president is black...feels good to say. Thank you for all you've done and all you represent. #ThankyouObama 
A photo posted by Zendaya (@zendaya) on Jan 20, 2017 at 8:43am PST 
Gina Rodriguez What face do you make when the President says yes to a selfie!!?!?!! You are already missed! (Mean comments will be blocked, don't steal my joy) #farewell 
A photo posted by Gina Rodriguez (@hereisgina) on Jan 19, 2017 at 2:54pm PST 
Khloé Kardashian “I’m asking you to believe. Not in my ability to bring about change — but in yours.” Terribly sad to see you go but honored I was able to watch firsthand. I hope our history books will do you justice. 
A photo posted by Khloé (@khloekardashian) on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:03am PST 
Gigi Hadid Thank you. ❤️ 
A photo posted by Gigi Hadid (@gigihadid) on Jan 11, 2017 at 2:16am PST 
Viola Davis Let’s say thanks to the Obamas - share your story with them at Obama.org and follow @obamafoundation 
A photo posted by Viola Davis (@violadavis) on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:46am PST 
Adele ✌ 
A photo posted by @adele on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:41am PST 
Ayesha Curry Thank You! 
A photo posted by Ayesha Curry (@ayeshacurry) on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:49am PST 
Danai Gurira The day I have dreaded. My thank you to President and First Lady Obama https://t.co/ArwWo5DKon pic.twitter.com/UvQxVdz5Qh 
— Danai Gurira (@DanaiGurira) January 20, 2017 Janet Mock Stay focused, y'all. 
A photo posted by Janet Mock (@janetmock) on Jan 20, 2017 at 6:16am PST 
Taraji P. Henson #TBT not so far back. I wanted to grab their ankles and beg them NOT TO LEAVE!!!! I have a lump in my throat. I HAVE NEVER BEEN THIS EMOTIONAL about a President and First Lady leaving the White House. NEVER!!!! Thank you @barackobama @michelleobama THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE TO THE WORLD! Thank you for hope. Thank you for real change!! Thank you for never wavering on faith. Thank you for being a model example of how a strong union between husband and wife can stand side by side STRONG AND FEARLESS against ALL adversities and not be broken or phased ever . JUST Thank you!!!! #my❤ Enjoy your lives you deserve all of life's sweetness because you gave SO MUCH!!! GOD BLESS YOU BOTH FOREVER!!! 
A photo posted by taraji p henson (@tarajiphenson) on Jan 19, 2017 at 3:36pm PST 

Elizabeth Warren Thank you, President @barackobama. We'll miss you. 
A photo posted by Elizabeth Warren (@elizabethwarrenma) on Jan 20, 2017 at 6:32am PST 
Bella Hadid Thank you, I love you ❤ #Obama #OURpresident. 
A video posted by Bella Hadid (@bellahadid) on Jan 10, 2017 at 7:07pm PST 
Rihanna worst breakup ever. 
A photo posted by badgalriri (@badgalriri) on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:22am PST 
Wendy Davis Thank you President Obama for 8 years of dignified service and the sacrifices you and your family made for all of us. #FarewellObamas 
— Wendy Davis (@wendydavis) January 20, 2017 Janelle Monaé "The one true king and queen of the North." 
A photo posted by Janelle Monáe (@janellemonae) on Jan 19, 2017 at 4:18pm PST 
Ellen DeGeneres . @POTUS @BarackObama , you changed our world. #ThankYouObama pic.twitter.com/FrxTIzNNZm 
— Ellen DeGeneres (@TheEllenShow) January 20, 2017 Jurnee Smollett Bell Feeling a lot of emotions. I remember meeting then Senator @barackobama 9 years ago. I'd been invited to introduce him in Nevada during the primaries. He was the underdog, the odds were stacked against him. Said he was too young, too black, too different...he was an other. I've always been an other so I saw myself in him. My own relative told me I was wasting my time, going state to state, knocking on doors for this guy with the funny name. I can't tell you how many people hung the phone up on my sister @jazzsmollettwarwell and me as we clocked in our hours, phone banking. Working as if this was a full time job, I worked for free, because this work was food for my soul. They whispered that you couldn't do it. That we couldn't do it. And then tried to block you even when we proved them wrong. TWICE. You will go down as the greatest president who did the most with the least help from his "congressional leaders". So I thank you for being you. Unapologetically. Your very existence demanded that I take the limits off my own. Before you, I lived in a world of boundaries and limits. You were audacious enough to dream big, and demanded we dream even bigger. So thank you for all you've given us. We will keep dreaming, keeping fighting, keep knocking on doors, keep traveling and spreading the gospel truth. Because it never was about you, it was about us, the "others". Yes we can. Yes we did. Yes we will.#powertothepeople ✊ #ThanksObama #tbt #mypresident 
A photo posted by Jurnee Smollett Bell (@jurneebell) on Jan 19, 2017 at 9:31pm PST 
Olivia Wilde This photo. This just finally did me in. My heart hurts. Thank you, Mr President. 
A photo posted by Olivia Wilde (@oliviawilde) on Jan 20, 2017 at 6:18am PST 
Kerry Washington #ThankYouObamas - share your story with them at https://t.co/XpjUx3uAbf and follow @obamafoundation https://t.co/O0AbiYSvVN 
— kerry washington (@kerrywashington) January 20, 2017 Demi Lovato Thank you. 
A photo posted by Demi Lovato (@ddlovato) on Jan 20, 2017 at 8:28am PST 
Rowan Blanchard Gonna miss u ❤️ so lucky to have grown up with u via @laurabrown99 
A photo posted by Rowan Blanchard (@rowanblanchard) on Jan 19, 2017 at 7:18pm PST 
Don’t forget to give yourself a little love today , you deserve it.
